Kural_Info.Tamil_Text: முகத்தின் முதுக்குறைந்தது உண்டோ உவப்பினும் காயினும் தான்முந் துறும்.
Kural_Info.English_Meaning: Is there anything so full of knowledge as the face ? (No.) it precedes the mind, whether (the latter is) pleased or vexed.

Layered_Composition.Foreground: A person's face is shown in a state of rapid, subtle transformation.
Layered_Composition.Midground: Two events happen. First, they receive joyful news, and their face instantly lights up with a smile ('உவப்பினும்'), even before the feeling has fully registered in their mind (visualized as a slowly glowing heart). Second, they receive bad news, and their face immediately contorts in a frown ('காயினும்'), again, faster than the heart can react.
Layered_Composition.Background: This shows the face as the most intelligent and fastest of communicators, always preceding and announcing the inner emotional state ('தான்முந்துறும்').

Art_Direction.Subject_and_Action: Is there anything more perceptive than the face? Whether in joy or in anger, it is always the first to show it.
Art_Direction.Symbolic_Motifs: The key is the speed of the facial reaction compared to the slower reaction of the symbolic 'heart'. This illustrates that the face is 'first'.
Art_Direction.Mood_and_Emotion: Expressive, immediate, revealing, intelligent (in its own way).
Art_Direction.Lighting_and_Color: The lighting on the face changes instantly with the emotion. The emotional core (heart) has a delayed lighting effect.

Technical_Cues.Camera: A high-speed, slow-motion close-up on the face, capturing the instantaneous micro-expressions.
Technical_Cues.Resolution: 8K, with a focus on capturing subtle, fleeting emotions.
Technical_Cues.Lighting: Dynamic lighting that shifts rapidly to match the mood.

Cultural_Anchors: The Face as the First Herald ('தான்முந்துறும்')

Negative_Prompt: emotionless face, slow reactions, text artifacts, cartoonish.
